item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Literature is a luxury; fiction is a necessity." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "I am not absentminded. It is the presence of mind that makes me unaware of everything else." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "I would maintain that thanks are the highest form of thought; and that gratitude is happiness doubled by wonder." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Without education, we are in a horrible and deadly danger of taking educated people seriously." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "There are no uninteresting things, only uninterested people." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "The way to love anything is to realize that it may be lost." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "The Christian ideal has not been tried and found wanting. It has been found difficult; and left untried." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G. K. Chesterton
item.description: "Because children have abounding vitality, because they are in spirit fierce and free, therefore they want things repeated and unchanged. They always say, "Do it again"; and the grown-up person does it again until he is nearly dead. For grown-up people are not strong enough to exult in monotony. But perhaps God is strong enough to exult in monotony. It is possible that God says every morning, "Do it again" to the sun; and every evening, "Do it again" to the moon. It may not be automatic necessity that makes all daisies alike; it may be that God makes every daisy separately, but has never got tired of making them. It may be that He has the eternal appetite of infancy; for we have sinned and grown old, and our Father is younger than we." -- G. K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Drink because you are happy, but never because you are miserable." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "It [feminism] is mixed up with a muddled idea that women are free when they serve their employers but slaves when they help their husbands." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Dear Sir: Regarding your article 'What's Wrong with the World?' I am. Yours truly," -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Poets do not go mad; but chess-players do. Mathematicians go mad, and cashiers; but creative artists very seldom. I am not, as will be seen, in any sense attacking logic: I only say that this danger does lie in logic, not in imagination." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Marriage is a duel to the death which no man of honour should decline." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "The obvious effect of frivolous divorce will be frivolous marriage. If people can be separated for no reason they will feel it all the easier to be united for no reason." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G. K. Chesterton
item.description: "You say grace before meals. All right. But I say grace before the concert and the opera, and grace before the play and pantomime, and grace before I open a book, and grace before sketching, painting, swimming, fencing, boxing, walking, playing, dancing and grace before I dip the pen in the ink." -- G. K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "The world will never starve for want of wonders; but only for want of wonder." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G. K. Chesterton
item.description: "Music with dinner is an insult both to the cook and the violinist." -- G. K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Reason is itself a matter of faith. It is an act of faith to assert that our thoughts have any relation to reality at all." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "For children are innocent and love justice, while most of us are wicked and naturally prefer mercy." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "My country, right or wrong,” is a thing that no patriot would think of saying except in a desperate case. It is like saying, “My mother, drunk or sober." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "We should always endeavor to wonder at the permanent thing, not at the mere exception. We should be startled by the sun, and not by the eclipse. We should wonder less at the earthquake, and wonder more at the earth." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "The most incredible thing about miracles is that they happen." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "[Fairy tales] make rivers run with wine only to make us remember, for one wild moment, that they run with water." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "There are two ways of getting home; and one of them is to stay there." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "To complain that I could only be married once was like complaining that I had only been born once." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "According to most philosophers, God in making the world enslaved it. According to Christianity, in making it, He set it free. God had written, not so much a poem, but rather a play; a play he had planned as perfect, but which had necessarily been left to human actors and stage-managers, who had since made a great mess of it." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "He may be mad, but there's method in his madness. There nearly always is method in madness. It's what drives men mad, being methodical." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "I wish we could sometimes love the characters in real life as we love the characters in romances. There are a great many human souls whom we should accept more kindly, and even appreciate more clearly, if we simply thought of them as people in a story." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Mike add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "The riddles of God are more satisfying than the solutions of man." -- G.K. Chesterton
